content:
6:58 PM

We want to make you aware of the upcoming January HL7 FHIR Connectathon that will take place January 13-15. CARIN will have a track at the Connectathon and will an Information Session in early January.

The HL7 FHIR Connectathon features hands-on FHIR development and testing. Register here:
http://www.hl7.org/events/fhir/connectathon/2021/01/?ref=signature
Early bird registration deadline is December 30, 2020.

Please sign up for the CARIN track here: https://bit.ly/CARIN-SignUp

Hi @Mark Roberts Is there any flexibility in the testing schedule? Looks like it's Thursday 400-700p and Fri 800-900a. Some of my team may have conflicts during the evening slot and wondering if the Friday sessions could start earlier or end later if other participants are willing?

Information Session
We will hold an Information Session today
January 11 from 3:30-4:15 pm ET to provide an overview of the track and Connectathon to help prepare participants for next week.

Information Session Zoom info:
Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android: https://leavittpartners.zoom.us/j/91371808279?pwd=dnRTZUJyQ2xIUVRCYzViNGQramhhZz09
Password: 522324
Or Dial:
+1 646 876 9923
Meeting ID: 913 7180 8279

Connectathon Info
Please sign up for the CARIN IG for Blue Button® track here: https://bit.ly/CARIN-SignUp
Track Page: http://bit.ly/2KeGr7R
A dedicated Zulip channel for the Connectathon can be found here: https://bit.ly/CARIN_Zulip
Draft Track Schedule (all times PT)
Times and sessions are subject to change.
Thu, Jan 14
08:00 AM – 08:30 AM Kick off
08:30 AM – 09:30 AM CARIN IG Technical Overview
09:30 AM –10:00 AM Ask IG Leads Anything
10:00 AM – 12:00 PM Lunch/Client-Server Testing
12:00 PM – 01:00 PM Aegis Touchstone Overview & Q/A
01:00 PM – 02:00 PM Overview of Draft Vision and Dental CPCDS and Mapping
02:00 PM – 03:00 PM CAQH Endpoint Directory Overview/Demo
03:00 PM – 04:00 PM Examples Review
04:00 PM – 07:00 PM Client-Server Testing

Fri, Jan 15
08:00 AM – 09:00 AM Client-Server Testing
09:00 AM – 10:00 AM Ask the SMART App Launch Developers Anything
10:00 AM – 11:00 AM Ask IG Leads Anything
11:00 AM – 12:00 PM Lunch/Client-Server Testing
12:00 PM – 3:00 PM Demos/Lessons Learned From Servers & Clients/Client-Server Testing
3:00 PM – 3:30 PM Wrap-up and Report Out
@Tone Southerland There is also a testing window between 10am -12 pm PT on Jan 14. @Amol Vyas and I will look to see if there might be some additional windows we can carve out.

Today, we held an Information Session to provide an overview of the CARIN track at the HL7 FHIR Connectathon on January 13-15. We also answered a number of questions that might be helpful as you prepare for the Connectathon.

A recording of the session can be found here:
https://leavittpartners.zoom.us/rec/share/E6q-gkBVfDLhmMSrU7O26dcKneRDoRNGxsBOZdcYVJYpoNxc9my53gNYTjPz8Pap.iFdkulxIcWDdhtmF Passcode: h@0c6N.S

The PPT can be found here:
CARIN-Track-HL7-Connectathon-Prep-Session-011121.pdf

CARIN Track Participants - The Touchstone FHIR Testing Tool has some CARIN for Blue Button testscripts available if your system is ready to be tested. They are located in Touchstone: https://touchstone.aegis.net/touchstone/testdefinitions?selectedTestGrp=/FHIRSandbox/CARIN&activeOnly=false&contentEntry=TEST_SCRIPTS or the same set of scripts was placed in the main Connectathon 26 folder in Touchstone for ease of locating them.

Please let us know if you need any assistance at touchstone_support@aegis.net or we have stream here on zulip at #touchstone.
Is there a Zoom url for Kick Off? The track page just redirects here.
@Gerard Carey you get the Zoom url from Whova
Thanks
What is Whova?
It's the platform the connectathon is running on
I haven't seen any requests come in for apps. Anyone interested in testing out Cigna/evernorth's FHIR server?

Alan Viars said:

What is Whova?

The Web app version is here: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hlsfh_202101/
@Jason Teeple add your sever here for the apps to find it: https://bit.ly/CARIN-SignUp
We asked @Mark Roberts to add our FHIR server since we cannot access the google doc.

Hi all, the server endpoints are on the Google Doc here: https://bit.ly/CARIN-SignUp. However, for those not able to access Google Docs, please download this Excel. It includes the latest updates as of 4:28 pm ET.

https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=97464608&preview=/97464608/97477635/2021-1%20CARIN%20Consumer%20Directed%20Payer%20Data%20Exchange%20(CARIN%20IG%20For%20Blue%20Button%C2%AE).xlsx
@Joel Hansen does the Aetna server still requires PKCE ?
I was able to find the Aegis scripts mentioned above. Thank you.
Unfortunately I had to miss the connectathon. Are any recordings available from the information sharing sessions?

On thursdays session (I think thursday) there was a presentation on a portal that simplified 3rd party apps to connect to payer endpoints. It had an area where 3rd party apps needed to present to certification (test results). Does anyone remember what that portal was called and possibly what section in the Confluence 26 it was presented in. Thanks!
@Ron Jawanda It sounds like you are recallling the CAQH (and Edifecs) Payer Endpoint Directory. https://www.caqh.org/solutions/caqh-endpoint-directory
that is it! Thank you!
Does anyone know when the new CARIN dental profile additions to the CARIN template will be available to the public?
Looking for the same answer. I think we will just have to map to C4BB ExplanationOfBenefit Professional NonClinician for now.
The CARIN BB Project team is currently working on the dental profile mapping. The team is also evaluating which ballot cycle the version of the IG can be balloted in.
